title: cannot infer an appropriate lifetime for pattern should have fix suggestions

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

labels.name: D-confusing
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error that should be reworked

labels.name: D-verbose
labels.description: Too much output caused by a single piece of incorrect code

body:
While I love NLL, I see, that the error messages one gets are way too complicated.

Example: 
[Stable][0] vs. [Nightly][1]

This question came up on [SO][2] and I find this very confusing to new people and if NLL lands in the next iteration of stable, I would suggest using the old recommendation. 

[0]: https://play.rust-lang.org/?gist=2f93c2bdac0bc7ce186e2bb3015be663&version=stable
[1]: https://play.rust-lang.org/?gist=2f93c2bdac0bc7ce186e2bb3015be663&version=nightly
[2]: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/49997429/max-by-key-on-map-doesnt-allow-destruct-of-tuple-into-key-value-pair/49997496#49997496

----

(*Update from pnkfelix:* As discussed in comment thread, NLL is not relevant here. The given examples are not opting into using the feature.)
